bodydiv.p: A deferred tax asset shall be recognised for all deductible temporary differences to the extent that it is probable that taxable profit will be available against which the deductible temporary difference can be utilised, unless the deferred tax asset arises from the initial recognition of an asset or liability in a transaction that:

li.p: at the time of the transaction, affects neither accounting profit nor taxable profit (tax loss); and
at the time of the transaction, does not give rise to equal taxable and deductible temporary differences.

bodydiv.p: However, for deductible temporary differences associated with investments in subsidiaries, branches and associates, and interests in joint arrangements, a deferred tax asset shall be recognised in accordance with paragraph 44.
